intro: Pleopeltis villagranii, commonly known as the Villagrana's rock fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, hairy underside. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of the leaves, which are released during the wet season. Pleopeltis villagranii is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
